definition[0]: an illness or a medical condition in which you have a very high temperature
example[0]: Andy has a fever and won’t be coming into work today.
example[1]: I woke up this morning with a fever and an upset stomach.
example[2]: She’s running a fever  (=has a fever).
example[3]: The usual symptoms are a pink rash with a slight fever.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually use fever to talk about a very high temperature. If someone's temperature is just high, they say that someone has a temperature rather than has a fever:
example[4]: He stayed home from school because he had a temperature.
definition[1]: a situation in which many people feel very excited or feel very strongly about something
example[5]: Soccer fever has been sweeping the nation as they prepare for the World Cup.
example[6]: a fever of excitement on Wall Street
